page.title: 19HOW RESIDENTS SEE DENHOLME
page.content: Many Denholme families have lived here through several generations for up to 2OO years. They have seen{Denholme change from being a{busy mill town}to {a functional village}with the decline of the woollen industry, resulting in derelict buildings and passing of the railway, bank, cinema, cafe, launderette, park band concerts. The {change of local government}to Bradford Metropolitan D.C. in l974 still disturbs many residents, feeling they are paying{rates}for facilities out of their reach. But hobbies being mainly home-based, old and young alike are drawn to living here for its proximity to the{moors and countryside,}the interesting and varied walks, the sport and sailing facilities, the park, the{friendly village atmosphere, and the happy, excellent First Schools and Nursery.
